meanings.definition: Existing, happening, or done at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The two friends arrived at the party concurrently.
meanings.sent2: The students worked on their projects concurrently.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized swimmers moved concurrently in the pool.
meanings.sent4: The cars on the highway moved concurrently like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The music and fireworks started concurrently, creating a spectacular show.

meanings.sent1: She completed her tasks concurrently to save time.
meanings.sent2: The team members worked concurrently on different sections of the report.
meanings.sent3: The chef chopped the vegetables concurrently, impressing the audience.
meanings.sent4: The birds flew concurrently in the sky, painting a beautiful picture.
meanings.sent5: The dancers moved their feet concurrently to the beat of the music.

meanings.sent1: The lights turned on and off concurrently during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The siblings spoke concurrently, causing confusion in the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The kittens pounced on the toy concurrently, creating a playful scene.
meanings.sent4: The leaves fell from the trees concurrently, covering the ground in a blanket of colors.
meanings.sent5: The athletes crossed the finish line concurrently, resulting in a tie.
